main event: On August 22, 1956, in Atlanta, Georgia, a ground-radar observation reported a small jet-like object making rapid turns and traveling a distance of 2-3 miles in 2-3 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as small, jet plane-like, and larger than a basketball, with bright luminous appearance.
It made a rapid turn straight out of sight and then returned, moving straight up and down
The observation lasted 2-3 minutes, and the object was seen by the operator as well as a low-flying aircraft in the area
There were no known photographs of the sighting
The observer was uncertain about the size of the object and it was speculated to be a probable exhaust or afterburner from an aircraft in the area
sighted object: small, jet-like object with bright luminous appearance
